message: I'm trying to allow some backends to create users, but not others.  However, I want to allow any of them to associate and then be used for login later.  Is this use case supported somehow?
I don't think it's supported out of the box. If you enable new user creation, then it applies to all backends.

The question now is how.  Register seems like it should be parallel to authenticate and associate rather than a hidden feature of authenticate.  On the other hand, it would probably be easier to make it data-driven with an additional check to settings.CREATE_USERS_<BACKEND>.
Digging in to the code, I think I need to change the authenticate method at https://github.com/omab/django-social-auth/blob/master/social_auth/backends/__init__.py#L94
I'm undertsnad your point and agree.
